column4: Can anyone give me a hand with this crontab? http://www.pastebin.com/849385
I've got a crontab working, but it isn't doing what I want.
In what sense?
You can see it here http://www.pastebin.com/849385 I did a sudo crontab -e to create it. The crontab executes, but it restarts the computer instead of locking the perosn out
Thanks, I'll have a look.  One difference: I want a cron as a user, not as root.
Well, not sure why cron is killing your computer, but the syntax is just as I expected it.  No differences there.
So you didn't have to do anything special to create that crontab?  Just crontab -e, right?
Yes
Because I just can't seem to get cron to notice my crontabs!
I've never tried to create a user one, only root
I tried to create a root one, too.  No difference.
Cron just doesn't care about me.
Not even when I'm pretending to be root.
(sniff)
Not sure what to say, I'm here for crontab help too
Weird!  I killed and restarted the cron daemon and the little bugger finally noticed my jobs.
Very strange.  It doesn't notice changes unless I restart it.
Or perhaps at some  other times?
Not what I've come to expect from Slackware's cron daemon.
I guess my problem was transient.  Sorry, I've never tried to log someone out via cron jobs, so I'm not sure I can help you.
But have you tried your approach "by hand"?
Just trying it now, the system's in another room, I can't log him out because he isn't part of sudo, though I can log myself in as only user and try it, brb
Sounds good...
